questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about data models and pivot are true? (Choose all that apply.)

choices.D: Pivot allows the creation of data visualizations that present different aspects of a data model.
choices.B: Data models are created out of datasets called pivots.
choices.C: Pivot requires users to input SPL searches on data models.

discussion.content: I think only D is correct

comments.content: B seems to me wrong also, because pivots are based on datamodel datasets

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - Datasets are not created out of pivots.

Selected Answer: A
Option AD:
Explanation:
A. They are both knowledge objects.: This statement is true because both data models and pivot tables are considered knowledge objects in Splunk. They enable better data management and analysis.

B. Data models are created out of datasets called pivots.: This statement is false. Data models are structured representations of data that may include datasets, but pivots themselves are not the building blocks of data models.

C. Pivot requires users to input SPL searches on data models.: This statement is false. Pivot does not require users to input SPL searches; instead, it allows users to create visualizations and reports based on drag-and-drop interactions with data models without needing to know SPL.

D. Pivot allows the creation of data visualizations that present different aspects of a data model. This statement is true. The pivot feature enables users to create various visual representations of data based on the underlying data model.

A. Yes, they are both konwledge objects.
B. Wrong, it is the other way around
C. Wrong, Pivot does not require users to input SPL searches on the data models. the key feature of pivot is that it allos users to create reports and visualization based on data models without needing to write any SPL queries directly. 
D. Yes

Selected Answer: AD
A and D boys

Selected Answer: AD
A and D, choose all that apply.

Selected Answer: AD
A and D is correct (due to multiple selection)
A could be true too
A maybe correct?

Selected Answer: D
D only, B is not a correct answer
D is correct, A is wrong because Datasets are not created out of Pivots rather Data Model provides the Datasets for creating Pivot

Selected Answer: D
answer is only D

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D only. Ddata models provide datasets for pivots. So B is wrong.
Only D: p229 "... data model that provides the datasets for pivots" makes B invalid.

questions.question_text:
Data model fields can be added using the Auto-Extracted method.
Which of the following statements describe Auto-Extracted fields? (Choose all that apply.)

choices.D: Auto-Extracted fields can be added if they already exist in the dataset with constraints.
choices.C: Auto-Extracted fields can be given a friendly name for use in Pivot.
choices.A: Auto-Extracted fields can be hidden in Pivot.
choices.B: Auto-Extracted fields can have their data type changed.

comments.content:
A. Hidden in pivot page#241 using field flags can be hidden
B. Data type if same as field type, can be changed to string number Boolean etc
C. Can be given a friendly name using display name field
D. Page 239 ...true 

So all answers seem to be correct

discussion.content: P239, I would say all answers are correct
ABCD is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
ABCD Correct Answer.
Definitely ABCD are all correct.

Correct answer should be ABC
D is not correct cause we can only do Auto-extraction for only root events, not child events even though they have added constrains.
ALL are correct

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a function of the Splunk Common Information Model (CIM)?

choices.A: Normalizing data across a Splunk deployment.
choices.C: Algorithmically shifting events to other indexes.
choices.B: Providing templates for reports and dashboards.
choices.D: Reingesting previously indexed data with new field names.

questions.question_text: What information must be included when using the datamodel command?

discussion.content: only the reserved word 'datamodel' is required per the syntax of | datamodel [<data model name>] [<dataset name>] [<data model search mode>] [strict_fields=<bool>] [allow_old_summaries=<bool>] [summariesonly=<bool>]

Syntax

Required arguments
None
